title: Beyond the Big Issue : Digital Storytelling project
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Homeless persons
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Unemployed - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Unemployment - Australia
abstract: Nine stories by The Big Issue vendors about their lives and how working for The Big Issue has helped them.
description: Nine of Melbourne's homeless and disabled share the stories of their lives and talk about how The Big Issue has changed their circumstances. They also talk about their interests, friends, family, daily struggles and how working for the Big Issue has helped restore dignity to their lives.
